intro: Linaria heterophylla f. pseudotingitana, commonly known as the variable toadflax, is a botanical variant of the toadflax genus Linaria. It is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from lanceolate to ovate depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers in late spring to early summer. It is native to southern Europe and has been introduced to other regions as an ornamental plant. Its adaptability makes it a common sight in gardens and disturbed soils.
